intro: Ischnosiphon centricifolius, commonly known as the starleaf suncup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves that radiate outward, giving it a star-like appearance. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Ischnosiphon centricifolius is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
